tympanostomy and tube placement and adenoidectomy.
the left external auditory canal was examined under the operating microscope and cleaned of ceruminous debris.
an anteroinferior quadrant tympanostomy incision was made.
fluid was suctioned from the middle ear space, and a tympanostomy tube was placed at the level of the incision and pushed into position with the rosen needle.
cortisporin ear drops were instilled into the canal, and a cotton ball was placed in the external meatus.
